trans-unit.source: Markdown Language Server
Exclude '{0}' from link validation.
No header found: '{0}'
Header does not exist in file: {0}
File does not exist at path: {0}
No link definition found: '{0}'
Go to link definition
Follow link
Find file references failed. No resource provided.
Finding file references
Rename not supported at location
{0} cannot be found
Content Disabled Security Warning
Some content has been disabled in this document
Potentially unsafe or insecure content has been disabled in the Markdown preview. Change the Markdown preview security setting to allow insecure content or enable scripts
[Preview] {0}
Could not load 'markdown.styles': {0}
Could not open {0}
Preview {0}
Allow all content and script execution. Not recommended
Disable
Disable preview security warning in this workspace
Enable preview security warnings in this workspace
Enable loading content over http
Allow insecure content
Enable loading content over http served from localhost
Allow insecure local content
More Information
Select security settings for Markdown previews in this workspace
Only load secure content
Strict
Does not affect the content security level
Enable/disable dropping into the markdown editor to insert shift. Requires enabling `#workbench.experimental.editor.dropIntoEditor.enabled#`.
Enable/disable pasting files into a Markdown editor inserts Markdown links. Requires enabling `#editor.experimental.pasteActions.enabled#`.
Enable/disable all error reporting in Markdown files.
Validate links to other files in Markdown files, e.g. `[link](/path/to/file.md)`. This checks that the target files exists. Requires enabling `#markdown.experimental.validate.enabled#`.

Validate the fragment part of links to headers in other files in Markdown files, e.g. `[link](/path/to/file.md#header)`. Inherits the setting value from `#markdown.experimental.validate.fragmentLinks.enabled#` by default.
Validate fragment links to headers in the current Markdown file, e.g. `[link](#header)`. Requires enabling `#markdown.experimental.validate.enabled#`.

Configure links that should not be validated. For example `/about` would not validate the link `[about](/about)`, while the glob `/assets/**/*.svg` would let you skip validation for any link to `.svg` files under the `assets` directory.
Validate reference links in Markdown files, e.g. `[link][ref]`. Requires enabling `#markdown.experimental.validate.enabled#`.
Open links beside the active editor.
Open links in the active editor group.
Controls where links in Markdown files should be opened.
Controls how links to other Markdown files in the Markdown preview should be opened.
Try to open links in the editor.
Try to open links in the Markdown preview.
Enable/disable path suggestions for markdown links
Provides rich language support for Markdown.
Markdown Language Features
Find File References

Sets how line-breaks are rendered in the Markdown preview. Setting it to 'true' creates a
for newlines inside paragraphs.
Double click in the Markdown preview to switch to the editor.
Controls the font family used in the Markdown preview.
Controls the font size in pixels used in the Markdown preview.
Controls the line height used in the Markdown preview. This number is relative to the font size.
Enable or disable conversion of URL-like text to links in the Markdown preview.
Mark the current editor selection in the Markdown preview.
Refresh Preview
When a Markdown preview is scrolled, update the view of the editor.
When a Markdown editor is scrolled, update the view of the preview.
Open Preview
Toggle Preview Locking
Enable or disable some language-neutral replacement and quotes beautification in the Markdown preview.
Open Preview to the Side
Open Locked Preview to the Side
Change Preview Security Settings
Show Source

A list of URLs or local paths to CSS style sheets to use from the Markdown preview. Relative paths are interpreted relative to the folder open in the Explorer. If there is no open folder, they are interpreted relative to the location of the Markdown file. All '\' need to be written as '\\'.
Enable debug logging for the Markdown extension.
Required for loading styles configured in the workspace.
